page.title: 13Communications Revolution
page.content: {Communications}have been revolution- ised by developments in{electronics, and nearly every household has{radio {and television}receivers. These have broadened people's outlook but seems to have reduced social contact. Most households have their own{tele- {phone.}There are only two public tele- phones in the whole area. A good{postal service}exists. There are a number of{post boxes}and every household has at least one daily delivery. There is one evening and three weekly{local newspapers.}They are now under commercial pressure from four or five recently established{advertising {broadsheets}that contain some local news and are delivered free of charge to some parts of the area. A monthly{Parish Magazine}is widely circulated.
